description: Tried this restaurant with my boyfriend on Sunday and it was great! Our first time having Peruvian food so we asked one of the waiters for his recommendations and we weren't disappointed at all. Even the dips that came with the bread were delicious! We'll definitely be back in the future.
author: Tatiana S.

description:
No.
NO NO NO.

I do not recommend this restaurant for anyone looking to try Peruvian food for the first time.

I also do not recommend it for anyone who has had Peruvian restaurant food before.

I don't know who that leaves, but I do know that I would not recommend La Fina Estampa to ANYONE.

"La Fina Estampa" translates, literally, to "The Fine Print". Why, I wonder, would an entrepreneur name their restaurant that, and then allow their staff to contradict the eatery's name at every opportunity they get.

To begin with, the dining room is a little dank in its appearance. This was encouraging to me, however, because this often indicates that the food is the emphasis rather than the ambience. This wasn't the case here. The food perfectly matched the stale, uninspired momentum that the interior decorator began.

We were greeted, at this Peruvian restaurant, by a very sweet Chinese waitress. She was very nice to us through the twenty words of English she interchangeably used to say various versions of "I don't know" every time we asked her questions about dishes. For one of the people in my party, it was frustrating not knowing what to order when neither the menu nor the staff are telling you what you're eating.

We were presented with what appeared to be a grocery store baguette accompanied with a (very) lazy susan of condiments that were as boring as the room we sat in.

The other two members of my party ordered something. I don't remember what it was. I do know, however, that all I saw was some meat and chicken strewn over long grain 25 cents per pound rice. Maybe there was some kind of oil sprinkled over it. Maybe it was seasoned. I do not know. For $15.00 I would have expected there to be some effort at presentation. There was not.

I ordered the tripe apetizer. I'm adventurous like that. It was cooked PERFECTLY. In addition, one of the odd condiments on that lazy susan went better with the tripe than it did with bread. I was happy to have figured that out on my own.

I don't think this restaurant really cares whether you come back or not. Maybe their location guarantees them new victims, barring them from the need to develop customer loyalty. 

The service was good.

My food was good. I dont think my companions enjoyed theirs.

The dining room and wares were clean.

The one extra star they get from me is due to their knowing how to cook tripe that isn't "offal" in its odor.
author: Chef Ty ..

description:
Food is overpriced for the quality served. Service was adequate but nothing extraordinary. Management is the worst though: their CC machine didn't work for 5 different cards among our group of friends, and they started blaming it on us before realizing their system was down. No excuses whatsoever from them, and after 30 minutes of waiting, we just got cash outside and paid the rest of the bill. 
But surprise surprise, we got charged on our CCs still (with a nice random tip added on there). 

Avoid.
author: Terence F.

description: Staff is very mediocre ..can not take orders right , will ask you to order in advance because there is a party of 20 and there is no time for a party of 4 ...after the kids took over the dads restaurant name it just been going down ..GREAT SERVICE IS A MUST ...hire grown man instead of hiring kids to run the restaurant ..kids don't appreciate nothing  ... your server Luis was great but yall got rid of him and hire inexperience family members   good luck
author: Ron T.

description:
I have been sitting here for 45 minutes already, waiting for my food. Me and my coworker came here to grab lunch really quick and go back to work. I waisted my lunch brake only for waiting for food. Make sure that you call them 2 hours before planning to eat anything. 
Worst timing!!! Takes forever to get your order done.
I paid $19 for one meal and been waiting for 45 minutes already and still have not got it yet. 
Never coming back!

So I decided to add one picture after I discovered what I was served. 45 minuets of wait and this is what i got for $19 dollars
author: Zurab G.

description:
This Peruvian restaurant is very good. The service is great and the owners are very friendly. I had the change to talk with the chef and his wife, which are also the owners, and they are very friendly people. They care a lot about their customers and the food they serve! 

About the food, this time I ordered Bistec a la pobre. OMG, it was delicious and the portion were big! I am very satisfied and my belly said thank you! 

Totally recommended! Btw, you must try the anticuchos if you have the chance. They go fast because of its popularity.
author: Alberto W.

description: Good if you know what to order. Weird things as having fake Spanish Paellas. But there are good and tasty plates
author: Javi S.

description: Very sad to share that I think this restaurant is under a new ownership. I know they mentioned a new cook. I was disappointed to order my food and it came out tasting like stir fry. Waitress didn't know the little menu they have. Arroz con Pollo definitely had soy sauce in the rice, Had a hint on cilantro Taste but not at all what is suppose to look or taste like. Pollo Saltado was like stir fry... no hint of vinegar. I don't think I will be visiting this place again.
author: Natalie R.

description:
Awesome place. I don't understand why there is not a line. 
I always go to get the lomo saltado! Is so gooood..
I have tried other things in their menu and their very tasty too. The price is good, service is great and the food is delicious. You won't regret trying this place.
author: Nicolas B.

description: LFE has a nice selection of seafood dishes. I especially enjoyed their ceviche. Its is nice and spicy. We also had a paella with shrimp, clams and mussels that was also tasty. Service is fast and friendly. Our server really hustled in fact. They also stock Peruvian beers.  This was our first time trying Peruvian cuisine and we were not disappointed.  LFE is well worth a try. Street parking. Recommend.
author: Jerry M.

description: Excellent Peruvian food served by a guy that was helpful and passionate about this place. My favorite was their tripe dish which were grilled pieces that were delicious.  Wife loved her chicken and fancy rice dish.  Bathroom was clean which is my wife's pet peeve when we go somewhere.
author: Steve T.

description:
Actually 3.5 stars but rounded down because the interior was not anywhere near 4 star.  Interior seemed very tired, which did not make me want to rush back.

Our last Peruvian meal had been at a very expensive ceviche restaurant on the waterfront so we wanted to try a more homey Peruvian place

The food was good and service was very genuine.  Feels like the staff really cares.  Takes awhile for the food to be served, so we think it's really cooked to order.  Bread is served with three tasty spreads, complimentary unlike some upscale places that now charge for bread.

We shared the calamari, which was excellent. We also shared the seafood, sausage and chicken paella. It was ok, good seasonings but seemed like something I have cooked.  I like to eat restaurant food that I can't make.  

So a nice neighborhood place but I would not go out of my way to eat here.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I go to this place every year when I go up to San Francisco for the Edwardian Ball in January.
Every meal I've had has been excellent. Last time I had the Zarzuela De Mariscos. I've also had the Pollo A La "Fina Estamapa" and the Arros Con Mariscos A Lo Macho. All of them were very delicious! And the Sangria is perfect!
The service is excellent. So friendly and efficient. Luis was a great host and remembers us every year!
Such a wonderful restaurant. Would give it more stars if I could.
author: Kendall A.

description: i really wanted this place to be good. I love Peru. But this does not give Peruvian food justice.
author: flashegirl e.

description:
Every time I came to San Francisco I would stop at the restaurant to enjoy delicious Peruvian food. Since they changed locations and probably owners the dishes have suffered. I ordered a simple papa a la huancaína and it is nothing as you'd have in any household in Peru. The waiter explained that they had this recipe for ages, and having as main ingredients, turmeric, lime and "feta cheese". I'd like to know how this traditional Peruvian dish has something so foreign to it, as a greek component. Please do not make up stories about it.

Thank you for the years I've enjoyed your restaurant but this is nothing as I remember it.
author: Gian N.

description:
Never coming here again and here is why:

Coming from a Peruvian background, I can say that this is the worst Peruvian restaurant I have been to in the state of CA. We order a few dishes: antichuco, papa rellena, and lomo salltado. The cows heart beef in the Antichuco was raw. The marinated sauce was watered down and had a hint of vinegar. When I took my first bite of the beef, I chewed and had to spit it out because of how disgusting it tasted and relieved when I looked at it how raw it was. The Papa rellena's mayo had a very strange taste, might have been the reason why I had the runs for two days after eating here. The Lomo Saltado was a disgrace to Peruvian cuisine. The french fries were these enormous cuts, same with the tomatoes. The meat had absolutely no flavor and tough to even chew. Even after adding salt, it was simply horrible. Both my husband and I were shocked at how badly someone can ruin such dishes. There was only two serves that night and one person in the kitchen. The server was also extremely rude and gave us attitude about how "fresh the food is because its made to order" and he repeated this about 8 times. A friend of mine came here recently and warned me about it. She had a different meal and wasn't impressed but since I had never tried this Peruvian place, we decided to give it a try to find out whether or not it was bad or good. Her boyfriend had paid the bill and the next day, someone was spending hundreds of dollars all over the city. She warned me about this too and so we paid with cash just to be safe. So I highly do not recomment this place at all. There are a few other Peruvian places in the city that are worth your time and money.
author: Nancy M.

description:
This would have to be one of the best best best hidden gems of San Francisco! The food is second to none! Seriously, everything about this restaurant is absolutely amazing from the wait staff, the ambiance, and most importantly the food. Has to be the most delicious down home Peruvian cooking I have ever tasted. If you want a good old fashioned meal made with love, a meal that will stick to your ribs, and a meal that will fill you with joy... then this is the place for you. Easily a five star establishment.
The food will not disappoint!
author: Noelle S.

description:
Second time here recently...and overall really appreciate the family run "hole in the wall" type gem.

Love the homemade sauces and bread.

Ceviche (fish) - was really great. loved the citrus flavoring and portion was generous! 

Lomo Saltado - was OK. Steak was a tad overcooked, and french fries a little soggy but understand that can be a risk for this entree. Overall enjoyed the meal.

My friend ordered the lamb with mint sauce which was the better entree and tasted delish!
author: Lindsay G.

description: Hands down, my favorite place in the city. I've had my share of ceviche and this is the best I've ever had. The friendly and welcoming staff, always makes you feel at home.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Great little spot!

Love the lunch specials that are $9-11 on weekdays (closed on Mondays) that includes a soup or salad and the entree.  Lunch portions are about half the size of dinner portions.

LUNCH SPECIAL SOUP: super homemade flavor chicken noodle soup.  Incredibly tasty (a little salty) but this is the homemade chicken noodle soup you always want.  They only do this on weekday lunchtime.

LUNCH SPECIAL SALAD: huge salad with lettuce, tomato, avocado with a homemade dressing that is tart, sweet, and salty all at the same time.  I could have eaten 2 of these salads it was so flavorful.  They can make the salad at other times if you request it.  I'm not sure how much it is though.

ARROZ CON POLLO: chicken and cilantro rice.  I like this dish a lot because it has tons of flavor and for dinner it's chicken breast.  For lunch I couldn't tell but it seemed like they gave me a fatty piece of chicken thigh (most people might like that but I don't like dark meat).  

POLLO ALA FINA ESTAMPA: grilled chicken breast with rice and potato/yuca. Pretty good flavor but the chicken could have used more of that "steak" sauce.  Also, got this one to go and the portion of rice they gave seemed tiny compared to what you get in the restaurant

PAELLA: lunch special is still a pretty big portion with lots of seafood

SEAFOOD SOUP: pretty good but doesn't come with rice or any starch so it's not that filling

TAMAL: this is some good stuff.  Filled with chicken, egg, and an olive, seems simple, and it is. But it's just super flavorful and I love the onion salad they serve with it.  Only available at dinner.  I could just eat this all the time!

BREAD with HOT SAUCE AND CHIMICHURRI: wow those sauces are so good!  I started using them on everything.

Super friendly service and casual decor so you can just walk in.

Just a warning the takeout portion of rice seems a LOT smaller than the dine-in. And I like their rice, so that made me a little sad.

Unisex bathroom in the back. 

Accepts credit cards and gives you lollipops with your check.
author: Traci H.

description:
This little hole in the wall is easy to pass by, but should not be missed. The food is fantastic, authentic and fresh. I come here for lunch, just about every other week and order the same exact thing, every time. 

So what do I order that has me craving and coming back for more? The Parihuela Seafood Soup, it's absolutely delicious and leaves me craving it on even the hottest of days. Stacked with seafood, it has a very aromatic broth and very flavorful. I love it. 

Most meals come with a soup or salad, which I typically get the salad since I order the soup. My only issue is that the dressing is too salty for my liking, I typically get it on the side. My friend loves the chicken noodle and orders it every time with a new lunch special. Everything I have tried was great. 

I'm a big fan of Peruvian food and love this little spot. They seem to do it all just perfect from the sauces on the side to the dishes and flavor.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Best Peruvian I've had in all my 33 years of life. So much flavor. Absolutely amazing. I had the seafood rice dish. It was to die for. The merlo was also amazing!
author: Mike D.

description: This little hidden gem just off Polk has delicious lomo saltado! Sad to see it empty quite often, but I think it's because of the location, which is not super  obvious on the Main Street. The calamari is really good as well. I've had better ceviche elsewhere but it's pretty decent. Highly recommended!
author: Garrett L.

description: One friend recommended me this restaurant and I'm not disappointed of the result. Excellent quality of the food and the service was amazing. I recommend it
author: Léo S.

description:
This definitely felt like Peruvian cuisine with a lot of Spanish influence, and being that my friend and I were reminiscing about our trip to Barcelona, and wistfully dreaming of the late night, Sangria-drenched, dinners of Paella and amazing seafood, we decided to walk down the street to try La Fina Estampa.  Well it was our lucky night, because when we walked in, all of the tables were full except for one right in front that seemed to be waiting just for us!

Two Sangrias, por favor!

Our server, Luis, was awesome and the wonderful service made it a 5 star experience!  The bread comes with these 3 delicious sauces, a must have even if you've sworn off carbs forever.  We ordered the Ceviche De Pescado (with fresh white fish) and the Paella Marinera (seafood paella).  When they brought us the wrong Ceviche, Luis quickly fixed the problem, and even brought us an extra half carafe of Sangria to make up for it!  I guess those Sangria-drenched Barcelona nights will live on in SF, and I'll be back for more.
author: Giselle P.

description:
Ordered: Arroz con mariscos + carafe of sangria + ceviche
Caveat: This was Meh. I've experienced better. I wouldn't choose to return or introduce it to others, but if others wanted to go I would meet them there.

-------------------------

FOOD: 3 Stars: Ceviche was good, but a LOT of onions and a bit too sharp. Plenty of fish though. Would have been nice with chips or something to eat the ceviche with given how acidic it was. Arroz con mariscos had a lot of seafood but wasn't anything special. Would try something else.

DRINK: 2 Stars: Sangria was weak and too sweet. Wouldn't order again.

ATMOSPHERE: Casual but great for conversation. Seems like a family run establishment (which I love). 

SERVICE: Slow but we also went on the later side.
author: Christina K.

description:
Finally got to come around and eat here again and boyyyy did I sure miss this place. It is authentic Peruvian food! Fresh, delicious, and so tasty! 
They do not skimp on the portions at all.
It's a family owned restaurant and you can really tell the time, effort, and love they put in their food and atmosphere.
Calamari was amazing! It wasn't weighed down with breading unlike many other places.
My all time favorite meal here is their lomo saltado. It's so filling and always leaves me in a happy food coma after. 

The only thing I'd wish different about la fina estampa is how far they are from where I live.
author: Camille B.

description:
I really like this Peruvian restaurant. It is a small restaurant with a nice ambiance.  Customer service is very good. 

I tried a few items on the menu and they were very good. The Lomo Saltado was very good. The meat was tender and the soy sauce based sauce was flavorful. The rice was well cooked. The restaurant offers complimentary bread service with butter and three (oil and basil, hot pepper paste, hominy and corn) dips. The ceviche mixto was good. The meat (squid, white fish,shrimp) was spicy and fresh. The squid was very tender. It was very filling.  The Sangria was good. It was bit strong for me. It was topped with fresh fruit (pear??).  I also like their Spanish Omelette (Tortilla Española). It was fluffy, moist, and delicious. It was well made.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: We stumbled upon this place and we were so glad we did!! Amazing food, super friendly and attentive staff!  I had the stuffed crab shell which was delicious and the calamari appetizer was good too! I love the condiments they bring out to go with the bread and whatever else you want to put them on. I could have just eaten those all night. We were so stuffed we had to walk off the food! Lol!
author: Vicki M.

description:
If you want to eat something else, something different if you are not familiar with peruvian food this is the place to go to. If peruvian food is familiar my advice is the same. I have checked most of the peruvian restaurants in SF. Such a cebiche addict as I am.
This is proper portions only missed the crunchy fried mais. Amazing host, really good food. Next time when I am in SF, I will visit them every evening.
author: Jeroen V.

description: This place is gem. The chicken is delicious the sides are amazing! It was yummy food quiet in side and great service.
author: Missy V.

description: We went while on vacation in San Francisco. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted and the service was very attentive throughout the evening. I had a Peruvian dish that was comparable to paella. It was rice and seafood. The seafood was abundant!  The dish was both flavorful and plentiful. My wife enjoyed her meal as well, but was jealous of mine. Overall, one of our favorite meals in San Francisco. So nice and friendly.
author: Joseph H.

description:
Love this hole in the wall! 

For Saturday night dinner with a girl friend we wanted a casual, laid back place that is not Asian, burger, pizza or Italian. I know, lotsa restrictions :), and that pretty much left us with Latin American food. I found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try. I called them on Friday night for a 7pm reservation on Saturday.

The restaurant wasn't very crowded when I walked in. At least 2 other parties were Hispanic looking, so I was guessing the food must be somewhat authentic (proven to be true after I've tasted the food). We ordered the ceviche mixto and paella Valencia. The portions were extremely generous and the service was great - the server did not pressure us to order more or tried to rush us at all, which was so refreshing after having a super unpleasant experience the same day at a pricey afternoon tea room at Japantown. Sure, La Fina Estampa wasn't fancy at all. It was completely no frill but I'll take that any day over some pretentious, overpriced place with bad service. 

This place reminded me of my trip to Peru 3 years ago - laid back, friendly, delicious food at a bargain price. I'll be back!
author: Mel L.

description:
This place is one of the restaurants where you feel like the food is homemade. Everything is very tasty and service is nice.
One recommendation though is not to go there during the lunch time as they have a very small menu (roughly 10 items) and no appetizers or dessert.
My boyfriend is Peruvian and he said the food tasted quite similar to the authentic.
PS. Make sure you try the complimentory salsas they bring with bread.
author: Yéva M.

description:
Mas Delicioso! Food was incredible and the service was very genuine and felt like something we may have received in Peru. 

We loved the red spread and garlic spread they give you for the bread. As for our entrees, we ordered the seafood paella and the lomo saltado, a marinated steak dish with onions, tomatoes and french fries, which was recommended by our server. Everything was extremely tasty and fresh. We left very satisfied and will return. 

P.S. Make reservations ahead for dinner as it does get very busy and the wait got up to 45 minutes at one point for people without reservations.
author: Pres P.

description: Amazing, authentic Peruvian food!! I was recommended this restaurant by my Uber driver, who happened to be from Peru. He said this was "hands down THE best, and most authentic Peruvian cuisine he's ever tried in the US!" And he was right! The waiter was incredibly helpful and super nice - we chatted about the history of Peru, and discussed the various dishes. I loved every minute of it! The ceviche was AMAZING - perfectly marinated! Not overly spicy, or overly citrus flavored. Can't wait to go back to this quaint little gem of a restaurant!
author: Brittany K.

description: What a great Peruvian spot ! The ceviche and sangria are out of this world. We always end up with the same server who's great, we always get carried away and over order and be doesn't mind stepping in to tweak our order to make sure it's perfect. The sauces that come with the bread when you sit down are also great. I recommended ordering a bunch of different plates and sharing with your group. Don't be afraid to ask for recommendations, they have always done us well.
author: brittany g.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while walking home from work one day. Service was good and it's a cute little quiet spot. 

I ordered the Lomo Saltado and while I was disappointed they didn't have the spicy green sauce, I was SO INTO the chumichurri sauce they had on the table. I finished the whole container with my plate. I think the waiter was judging me or else I would've asked for more. 

Definitely will be back and would love to try the tallarin/noodles
author: Teresa T.

description: Fantastic experience on a Saturday night, and the Lomo Saltado was great. Highly recommend
author: Peter S.

description: The food here is simply delicious. My family ate here for lunch and it was amazing selection for the price!
author: Jannelle S.

description: It was really bad. I try many Peruvian food restaurants around San Francisco but this one is the worse. I wont recommend it. The food wasn't good neither the service!
author: Wilfredo N.

description:
The service here is great, but they are totally misunderstanding the new mandates for water consumption. When we sat down, the waiter explained to us that they weren't allowed to serve us tap water unless we requested-- and when we did-- IT WOULD ONLY BE ONE GLASS. That's it. The mandate is, you're allowed to have as much water as you want, as long as you request it. If you want a refill? You need to request it. They are not going to automatically refill it for you. That being said, they only gave us one glass of water the entire time, and then urged us to buy bottled water if we wanted more.  Um, what? Ok. 

Other than that, the food was average, and they ran out of alfajores. I also have crustacean allergies, and they unfortunately use the same deep fryer for everything. It was good they told us this, or else I'd be swimming in hives, but still-- you can't fry your shrimp or other known common allergens separately? Man. That removed like HALF of the menu (if not more) for me. Unfortunately, the lomo saltado wasn't as seasoned as I would have preferred, but it wasn't bad. The meat was at least fresh. Wish they hadn't run out of stuff, didn't misunderstand the SF Water Mandate, and didn't deep fry all their stuff in the same place. I probably won't be coming back here, but it wasn't terrible.
author: Christa Lei S.

description: Visiting San Francisco and found this restaurant on Yelp. Parked and waited for them to open. Gave them a call, they opened the door, and said all they have is 12 ostiones. No other option. Would have been great to know there is a special menu. Wouldn't have bothered or would have called ahead. Disappointed.
author: Linda G.

description:
I officially love Peruvian food! Thank you La Fina Estampa, for making that happen.

We stopped by for dinner on a pretty quiet Sunday. You'd never guess by the part of town that it's located in that it would be so nice and charming inside. Small place, family-run I believe. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. 

I ordered the Saltado De Pollo (the Lomo Saltado but with chicken instead of beef) and my husband had the Tallarin Saltado Con Pollo. Both were DELICIOUS. Mine came with a huge pile of white rice with a hint of garlic, which was amazing when soaked up with sauce from the rest of the dish. 

Not sure when we'll be back in that part of town, but if/when it happens, this is definitely a dinner option we'll strongly consider!
author: Ashley C.

description: Went last night with our entire family to celebrate my kids' graduation, Fantastic food and Fantastic service! Louis is very nice and his recommendations are right on the spot.  Will be a regular here when in the city.
author: Sasha K.

description:
My favorite Peruvian restaurant in San Francisco. So underrated.  I've been here several times and love love love their paella, lomo saltado (fish or chicken), and their dipping sauce. 

Dress code: casual
Service: Outstanding
Environment: intimate

Our waiter recommended us to have Bistec a la Pobre when we come back! Definitely looking forward for it!
author: Jennifer B.

description: This place is really good,great food,authentic Peruvian food,the only problem is the service is not really good and fast so went u came here take u time and don't desperate if the service take his time and don't pay attention to u.
author: Juan M.

description:
I just had the most delicious meal that I would eat again and again. Top 4 were our favorites, we ordered:

Paella - amazing and very moist
Lomo saltado - the sauce was to die for and the meat was excellent 
Ceviche mixto - great acidity and flavor
Stuffed crab - served in a good butter garlic sauce
Papa la huancaina - it was ok compared to how my dad makes it. Definitely Americanized. It wasn't as spicy and sharp as I'm used to.
Causa - Americanized, needed a bit more acid from lime to round the dish out.
Flan - average flan.

Needless to say the food was great and I'll be back. Only negative is they did not have lucuma for desert.
author: Foodie For Life L.

description: Without a doubt one of the best service in town for Peruvian dinner. We had the lomo saltado and the fish ceviche.  My son had the pollo frito. Everything tastes fresh. The onions on the ceviche were freshly cut and nicely seasoned. I will come back again with the family.
author: Coco P.

description: I should have written this a LONG time ago.  Family run Peruvian place with just excellent food made with family recipes.  Sometimes they run out so I try to go early.  The ceviche is fantastic, as is the chicken.  It's a tiny spot so it can get busy but it is worth the wait!
author: Elaina S.

description: I been going to this restaurant for over 6 years and the food and service is always great. Love the Ceviche and Lomo Saltado
author: Carla E.

description: If your taste buds are craving the rich flavors of Peruvian food and you're in the mood for an authentic dining experience, La Fina Estamwa is the place to visit. I shared the Ceviche De Pescado, Calamaris Fritos, and Arroz Con Pollo. All three dishes were bursts of flavor and spice. The service was great as our waiter was attentive and provided helpful recommendations. This is a great hub off of Polk Street.
author: Margie S.

description:
The food was great . Service was even better . They kept constantly checking with our party if we needed any thing . 

3 sauce with bread . Mind blowing . 

I ordered the seafood platter with rice & fries . Thoroughly enjoyed it till the last grain :) 

Will be back to tryout their other options . 

Hole in the wall place but don't miss it :)
author: K J.

description: First time eating Peruvian food and I was very pleased. Service was great and prices were worth every penny. If in SF, I would make a stop here again!
author: Dona D.

description: Lomo saltado and chicha morada was great but the papa a la huancaina is creamy but has too much of a bitter and sour taste. Service is good.
author: Johnny M.

description: Such a welcoming host - Luis. The dishes were wonderful. We had the ceviche mixto, traditional paella, and poor man steak. Seasoned to perfection. All were very DELICIOUS!!
author: Donn P.

description: One of my favorite spots to get seafood in SF. Super friendly - ask the waiter for recommendations and just go with it. Lots of healthy choices too
author: Alex F.

description: I had my first Peruvian meal here. Let me tell ya, in case you're not aware, lomo saltado is a bomb ass combination--beef, tomatoes, onions, fries, and rice. Apparently some places include eggs. Very good flavor. The meal is about $15, well worth it. The location of this place is cool, if you want a happenin' area on a night out. Polk St. is wild. The restaurant is on Bush, though, right around the corner, so you eat in quiet before possibly continuing your adventures. This isn't an elegant date spot, but it's not trashy either. Definitely good for dining alone or with friends. Service is so-so, initially friendly but not super attentive from there, but I loved my meal too much and wasn't otherwise in a mood to care. The not overwhelming music in Spanish is a nice touch.
author: Paulina F.

description:
Found this place one night I was on my way to Polk street to a party. Decided to come here with friends for one dinner night. It's a small place but feels very comfy. They have great food not too much of large portions. It's best to order several plates and share with your party. The waiter was very friendly and helpful with an awesome sense of humor.
I am happy I found this place and will def return!
author: Stacy G.

description: One of the best Peruvian restaurants i have been to. The atmosphere is is relaxing and the food amazing. The service was wonderful.
author: Guerra E.

description: First Peruvian food experience with my children. Host was awesome and very informative. Food delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Latara H.

description:
Oh my, what a meal. My family and I could not be more pleased with this place. Superb food and great service. Went super hungry after a day at the zoo. Our waiter was super accommodating to our starving son, he kept replenishing our bread service and brought our appetizer quickly.  Everything that we ate was really really great. Try the zarzuela de mariscos for a seafood medly in a tasty tomato-based sauce. Dip some bread in that sauce or use the rice that comes with it...delicious!
Also, try the Cusqueña beer. Medium body Ale. Very refreshing and tasty. Although we didn't try them, they also seem to have a great selection of wines. 
We're in SF for just a few more days but we'll be sure to come back before leaving town. This place is really great.
author: Sandy W.

description: Went here for lunch with family and we all thought it was just okay. First off.. We came in right when it opened at 11:30, but the doors weren't open. Then someone came out and told us to wait another twenty minutes because they "weren't ready yet." After deciding to wait, we finally sat. The waiter told us to hurry and order because it got even more busy. Food came out quick (I'll give them that),  but I've had better. Will we come back? Maybe...
author: Mertani G.

description:
I'm a Destino kinda guy, but now have to admit that closer to home, La Fina Estampa fits my gastronomic needs quite well. I love it! Tucked right off Van Ness Avenue on Bush Street, my friends Steve, Duane and I walked in yesterday evening for some great Peruvian food. We weren't disappointed! 

The person who seated us, as well as waited on us, seemed to be the owner of the place, or at least held a command over the people working there. A basket of bread served with an amazing chimichurri spread was amazing. A bottle of sangria was marvelous, and kept me on point until our Conchit A La Parmesana (scallops, parmesan cheese and white wine) ($10.95) and later my Saltado De Pollo (chicken sautéed with onions, tomatoes and French fries along with a nice side of rice ($13.95) arrived. The scallops and chicken were super-tender and the accompanying veggies and rice were moist and delicious. More bread was requested so I could sop up more of the "gravy" on all the plates. 

One final note is that we appreciated having the host mention to us as we arrived that certain items on the menu were no longer available. Since they order their meat daily, the more popular items sometimes run out sooner than expected.
author: David G.

description:
Go here, get the bisteak a lo pobre, and I swear on my Yelp account you'll love it. It's a thin steak draped over a piece of fried bread, topped with onions, tomatoes, and a fried egg, served with sweet fried banana, fried potato, and rice. Topped with their sensational chimmichurri, it's explosively flavorful. I've taken a dozen people to Fina over the years and each one has raved about the bisteak. It's hands-down my favorite dish in San Francisco.

I'm so happy they reopened on Bush, after having taken a friend to the Van Ness location a few years ago, only to find the owners in the final moments of moving out. I turned for a moment to commiserate with my disappointed friend, and when I turned back they were gone, the secret to their unmatched chimmichurri lost with them.

I also love Fina's chicharron de pollo, Spanish tortilla, New York steak, and super zesty salad dressing (salads aren't on the menu anymore, but they'll make one if you ask). Everyone who has ordered seafood has been pleased. The only dishes I haven't been crazy about were the arroz con pollo and paella.

I'm so worried that Fina Estampa won't get the attention it deserves. It's right off Polk but it's not flashy and is easy to overlook. On the plus side, not having been "discovered" means it's super approachable and you're seated immediately, a pleasant change for SF!
author: Lauren C.

description: I came here on a whim because our car got a flat tire.!We were hungry and decided on this place. And what a fantastic decision that turned out to be! The ambience of the Peruvian culture filled the room almost the same as the extremely delicious entrees. Highly recommend the " Mar y Tierra" plate.
author: Miguel M.

description:
The whole dining experience was just great, love the passionate host/server, the music, warm finishing &  decorations.
Exotic beef heart & seafood, recommended  of coz the Sangria too!
author: Jordan H.

description: One of the best peruvian restaurants in sf. Service is great and food its amazing they are not only a restaurant but an institution i been eating at their place since they have the place at the mission back in the 80's and still the flavors and the same never fail. Definatelly a 5 stars.
author: Carla K.

description: My favorite Peruvian spot in the city! Love the anticuchos, crispy chicken, & arroz con mariscos. The ceviche is also fantastic. La Fina Estampa is seriously a hidden gem. I love that we can just walk in during the week night without a wait and get a fantastic meal for ~$50.
author: Grace C.

description: We were in San Francisco back in September on vacation for a week and we went to La Fina Estampa twice, that's how much we loved it. We ordered ceviche which was perfectly seasoned. The chicharron de pollo comes with a lemony dipping sauce that compliments the chicken so well. We also ordered lomo saltado, tallarin saltado, and parihuela which were all delicious! The service was great, the gentleman that took care of us (both times) was super friendly and gave us recommendations of places to see during our vacation. We most definitely would return if we are ever back in SF again!
author: ChrisNWill B.

description:
Wow, they moved so stealthily I didn't even notice. I had been to the much more cavernous location that Fina Estampa (without the "La") had at Van Ness and Geary several times but didn't even notice it had subsequently closed. You could hardly tell a restaurant was there when it was open since it was hidden behind these huge doors with barely any windows. The new place is around the corner on Bush and much more conventional looking despite the Latin American decor. This is not the new-jack Peruvian food you would find at Destino or Piqueo's but the no-frills, home-style food you may find on some madrecita's dinner table in Lima.

It's run by the children of the original owner, and it's pretty obvious that their priority is maintaining the family recipes. Jamie W. and I met our good friends Jeremy and Nerissa there for a much overdue get-together a couple of Saturdays ago, and it was as still as a tomb on a rainy evening. That didn't stop us from eating muy bueno starting with the $6.50 Anticuchos, a couple of skewers of marinated beef hearts in Aji Panca sauce (see photo). They were more tender than you would expect from internal organs. As his entree, Jamie had the $12.95 Lomo Saltado, their signature dish with beef strips mixed with french fries, onions, tomatoes and special herbs (see photo).

The dish was classic Peruvian cuisine, really hearty and succulent. For me, I couldn't resist the $15.95 Paella Valenciana, no longer served in a skillet but on a plate with rice and sautéed shellfish mixed in a special saffron sauce with chicken and sausage thrown in for good measure (see photo). This was very satisfying and way too much for one sitting even for me. It actually reminds me of my dad's Hawaiian fried rice with a major splooge of Heinz ketchup. Downscale delicious even with all the clams, mussels and jumbo prawns. You will definitely not leave wanting a second meal. Just pay your check and leave with your doggie bag, or as they say in Peru, la bolsita del woof-woof.

FOOD - 4 stars...still as good and hearty as the food at the Van Ness location
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...the new place is nice but a bit on the generic side
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...thoughtful but didn't come check on us much once we were eating
TOTAL - 4 stars...like you have a Peruvian madre
author: Ed U.

description:
Group of friends and I came across this place yesterday while we were in the area and decided to give it a try. 

After perusing the menu for a while, I ended up getting the Tallarin Saltado Con Pollo (chicken sauteed with noodles, onions, and tomatoes). It was delicious, especially the sauce. There's also free bread that comes with a couple of salsas, all of which I summarily ignored because I kept dipping the bread into said sauce. 

The waiter also deserves his own paragraph for being very polite and accommodating. Even gave me updates of the Warriors game because the stream my phone had died due to bad signal! This place not serves good food, but some great basketball commentary to boot. It has nothing but my highest recommendation.
author: Justin C.

description:
I never had Peruvian before and I absolutely loved it. The waiter did an amazing job recommending me dishes and I ended up with Zarzuela. I enjoyed every bit of it, as well as the bread and the dip sauces. 

We paid less than 40 dollars for our dish and a bottle of Peruvian wine. Good deal! 
Definitely going to try more Peruvian places!
author: Judith S.

description:
This place is a hole in the wall, family owned Peruvian restaurant vs your chain peruvian restaurants such as Limon and Fresca.

They give you bread with sauces as an appetizer. The green sauce and the giant corn I LOVED. It was sooo addicting. That was the highlight of our meal.

We came on a weekday for lunch. They just opened and we were first ones there. We ordered the calamari, loma saltido, and paella. All dishes were decent, not outstanding. I didn't do the ordering, but I would definitely return to try more of their dishes.

Parking can be a bit tricky (street parking) which is no surprise for the location and it being in SF.

Will definitely need to return to try more items off their menu.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
We were quite surprised at how good the food was here. 

As others have mentioned, the place was quite empty when we arrived for lunch on a Saturday. There were just 3 tables occupied. That's usually not a good sign. But then again, we received super attentive, friendly, and efficient service! 

The free bread as you sit down comes with 3 different sauces.. um I totally wanted to put them in my bag LOL sooo good! We started with the calamari and wow cooked to perfection. I don't usually eat the tentacles but I devoured them here. So delicious.
For main, I had the lomo saltado which was really delicious. I don't know what they did to the rice but I want a whole tub of it.. soo good. The beef was cooked perfectly, the onions and tomatoes were succulent. Sometimes with this dish it can get too salty but here it was just perfect. My hubby ordered the Bistec a la Pobre.. which pretty much had everything with it such as egg, yucca, banana.. I was so jealous. I am totally ordering that next time. It was pretty amazing and delicious dish. We didn't have room for dessert and frankly, the food can be filling. 

I think it may be their location just off to the side of busy Polk street that people may miss them. Or maybe they are busier for dinner. But it doesn't matter to me.. the food is excellent. My favorite Peruvian/Spanish restaurant in SF so far. We'll definitely be back.
author: Vol T.

description: Celebrated our holiday party here and we had the best time! They were able to accommodate a large group and worked with me to choose the perfect menu ahead of time. When we arrived we had some delicious Sangria and shortly after, our food came out! The owners are so friendly and our host was awesome! Everything was delicious! We had the ceviche, calamari, chicharrón de pollo, tortilla a la española, saltado de pollo and Paella Valenciana! Can't wait to eat here again! Thank you Tammy for everything! We all had a really great time.
author: Yazmin L.

description:
When I'm in the mood for beef and a warm, friendly atmosphere, I come here.  I usually get the bistec a la pobre, which is satisfying, and a sangria.  The flan is good too.  

It's always the same waiter, and he is unfailing kind and polite- I think he's a big part of the reason I like this place.  I feel like I've been invited to dine in someone's home.
author: CAKE E.

description:
The food was okay, a little bland compared to other Peruvian dishes I've tasted but the  lack of stars is due to our waiter and the service that he gave. He was super unfriendly, and rude when answering questions (something as simple as what do you recommend). I am not even talking about bringing the bill, and cleaning some of the dirty dishes of the table. 

Also if you like to drink water bring your own.. since he could only give us one refill on our 4 oz glasses of water..... 

Definitely wont come back here because of the service since there are other Peruvian  restaurants.
author: Karina B.

description: a real low key, authentic hidden gem. more of a peruvian place than spanish. seafood is real good, specifically go for the ceviches.
author: Saurabh T.

description: This was one of the best seafood meals I've ever had!  I had the stuffed crab which included shrimp and crab in a butter sauce with a side of white rice and salad.  The crab was so fresh and the butter wasn't overpowering, was delicious!  My boyfriend ordered the shrimp with noodles and said it was also delicious.  Ambiance is great as it's quiet and calm inside, perfect to have a good conversation with your dinner.   This place is also reasonably priced, about $65 for dinner and drinks for two.  Will definitely visit next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Janet C.

description: Less than average Peruvian food.  The chicken was overcooked and I had to add spicy sauce to it just to give it flavor.  I had a piece of chicken too that tasted like liver, was not fun.  The ceviche was also average, nothing special.  The server was a nice guy, but couldn't give us any suggestions as to what to get.  He's like everything is made to order, which didn't taste that way.  Either they had premade the ingredients, overcooked it or the ingredients weren't that high quality.  Why does this city have such an issue having good Peruvian food?  I've been to Peru, there's no comparison!!
author: Mitch A.

description:
This place is the real deal! If you want real authentic Peruvian food look no further. 
Being that I'm half Peruvian my family used to come to this restaurant when I was a little kid. It was in the mission back then. It's moved three times since then but we haven't been back in a long time in part due to all the other trendy "Peruvian" restaurants that we wanted to eat at and frequented (which I now regret because I could have been eating here the whole time) until my birthday celebration yesterday.
The same chefs have been cooking here since it opened decades ago and they remembered my family and even me to my surprise!
Oh my God it's good to be home again!
Whenever I eat Peruvian I always get the Lomo Saltado but this time I want to try something different so I ordered the Bistec a la Pobre which I've never had before.
I can't express with words how out of this world that dish was! The egg yolk with the fried plantain and the onions and the crunchy bread that was under the steak soaking up the juices is making my mouth water as I type this even now! 
The rice soaked up the remaining juices which were ample and made that rice the best rice on planet earth!
The appetizers, papa a la huanciana, chicharon de pollo, and the anticuchos, oh my God, SO good! 
This place is THE BEST PERUVIAN RESTAURANT IN SAN FRANCISCO! 
You must eat here! I want to live there!!!!
author: Everette R.

description:
I was not expecting to be as impressed with this place as I was. Went with a large group a few nights ago and got to try and see a lot of things. The waiter (is he the owner too? Or manager?) was very friendly and when I told him (upon leaving) that I'd be back and was in the neighborhood, he gave me a copy of their lunch specials menu to take with me. A lot of the same courses we ate for dinner at much cheaper prices!!

Anyway...the tortilla española was really good. Not too heavy and full of flavor. I took a bite of the chicken chicharrones and thought it was just OK. Probably better with the dipping sauce but to me, good fried chicken has to be able to stand on its own.

My entree was the parihuela de mariscos, or seafood stew. It. Was. Delicious. Nice light tomato broth, with a little spice, and a great collection of shrimp, calamari, baby octopus and more. I would definitely have this again! And I will be back.
author: David B.

description: I had the ceviche mixto and the Lomo Saltado and they were terrific! My Peruvian friend who I went with told me that the food and presentation were authentic except the quality of the beef they used. But, for the price, it's pretty stellar! Their chiche (non alcoholic) drink was super yummy - perfect amount of sweetness! I give this place a HUGE thumbs up! Service was awesome too!
author: Rebs W.

description:
My family has been following Fina Estampa from the Mission where it started to Van Ness and now it's new location. 

Authentic, just I've had at my family's homes for the past thirty years and delicious.

I recommend the restaurant to any of my friends in the area.
author: Jeremy F.

description: THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD. If you like Peruvian food, or just good food in general, you will like this place.  Sangria was great, paella was great, and every other dish we got was great. Our server was very helpful with recommendations based off what we liked and what was fresh at the moment. I can't wait to come back here. SO GOOD.
author: Shawn T.

description:
1. Great Service
2. Authentic home - style Peruvian cuisine.

The owners are from Peru and they cook themselves. I love Peruvian good and I have eaten at all the well known Peruvian restaurants in San Francisco. Let's put it this way, everyone has their specialty but there is something seriously wrong when you're messing up your national dish, Lomo Saltado (Limon Rotisserie and sometimes Fresca consistently over cook their lomo saltado)

La Fina Estampa has a small menu but EVERYTHING tastes good. The anticuchos, Lomo saltado, bistec a lo pobre, bistec en ceballado...  everything. I never leave this place dissatisfied. Make sure to dip your bread in the Aji and chimichurri while you're waiting for your meal because they're delicious !  

No liquor here, just beer and wine but who cares ! Grab a glass of cab or some malbec and enjoy!

 It may not be the trendiest place in the city but you're getting quality that you're not going to find elsewhere. The next best thing is Fresca but you go there when you want a little flair. 

My personal favorite: Bistec a lo pobre. If you have am appetite and like steak and eggs, this dish is for you !!
author: Alireza P.

description:
Definitely a fan of this spot... been going here since it was in their old spot on Van Ness... but on my recent visit, the server kinda gave me hard time about getting a mixed Saltado (Chicken & Steak) ... and their side dishes have changed a bit.  

I'll have to go back and give it another try with the arroz con pollo, it was another favorite of mine.
author: Lynda N.

description: Talk about a hidden gem. The flavors one experiences here are incomparable. Fina Espampa is all I really know about Peruvian food, but it's all I need to know. It's delicious. I've come here 7 or 8 times in the last few years - even by myself once - and it's just so memorable and tasty. It's been the same waiter every time, btw. Even on a weekend night it's never crowded, which makes me concerned that they're doing ok. It would break my heart if they closed. Truly one of the tastiest places I've ever been to. My highest recommendation.
author: Sean F.

description:
The sangria had these gross dried out strawberries on the rims (note: carafe of sangria doesn't equal 2 full glasses of sangria apparently? odd) but other than that, everything was great!! the mussel appy was hugeeee and super stuffed (perhaps overstuffed?) and the paella was muy authentic. do it. do it now.

oh yes... the service is also friendly and it's a nice neighbourhood find.

18/30 yelp challenge
author: Sam W.

description:
So good 
Ate the arroz con pollo and the PIQUEO criollo good size portions and great customer service
I would recommend to my friends and I will come back
author: Julio L.

description: Amazing waiter took care of us. Seafood dishes are outstanding. Being from out of town, this place brought us lots of joy! It's for those who are looks for authentic dishes away from all the tourist traps.
author: Nina A.

description:
Our waitress was a sassy middle-aged woman with permed hair, who carried herself briskly in a way that reminded me of Univision telenovelas I used to watch with my Latino neighbor. I say this because she nothing but energy, spicy charisma and was VERY VERY Latina.  

The conchas a la parmasana was flavorful, and offered a nice smokey aroma that brought me back to a special place when I first tasted this during my first trip to Lima.

The sauces are all homemade and excellent; the Salsa Verde de Cilantro was probably my favorite. It offered the right amount of acidity with the shrimp and mussels in my seafood Paella. ¡Ay! I will admit that I think maybe they overdid it with the saffron in the rice, as I started to envision the lining of my stomach turning an iridescent golden hue with every successive bite, but overall it was still pretty tasty. I think maybe I just have a strong preference for more subtle flavorings. 

¡Buen! Can't wait to try something else next time.
author: Ty T.

description: Excellent food and customer service. The owner served us and was very friendly. Very personable place and delicious, authentic food. My husband and I each had a seafood dish that were incredible!
author: Lelia D.

description:
Food was underwhelming. I had the seafood paella and part of the arroz con pollo. Not bad, but not very good either.  

Service was friendly but we had to ask 5 times to get the check.

My credit card was charged twice and I had to dispute it with my credit card company. Probably just a mistake by a busy server. 

Added up, the experience wasn't good enough to repeat.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Oh boy. What a delicious meal! I was skeptical at first, as it really is a hole in the wall in an unassuming location. The meal was extraordinary, the service was extraordinary, and the experience was up there with the best finds in the City.

Try it. I dare you to find a flaw.
author: Ben S.

description:
I love all they're food. But i got to say that the Bistec 
Ala Pobre is my fav main dish. Don Gustavo makes the best sauce to go on top of the bread. All are so good. For appetizers the chicherones de pollo. I've been dining with them for more then 15 years ever since they had the original location on Van Ness. My kids love this restaurant as well. It is our go to special occasion restaurant.
author: Tiffany G.

description:
Giving it 4 stars since it's my first time going here and I got take-out. So this is purely based on first impressions and food taste. 
Having said that, first impressions were great. The staff was super friendly and the food (which was a huge portion) was super tasty. I got the Saltado de Pollo. Great seasoning, but not overly salty. They even called me to let me know my order was ready for pick-up when I didn't show up after 20mins of placing my order. 
Good people. Will be coming back and I'm sure the stars will go up to 5. =)
author: Betsy A.

description:
Stumbled upon this place with a friend last night. What a gem! The service was awesome, the prices were on point, and the food was absolutely delicious. I had the Arroz con Pollo and my friend had the Bisteck a lo Pobre. The servings are very generous and even though we were full about half-way through we pushed on because the flavors are so good. Don't be shy about using the toppings they provide on the table either (minty spicy awesomeness). 

Please give this place a try if you love Peruvian food or want to try something different.
author: Jaime W.

description: Great food! I had the lamb medium rare which was cooked perfectly. The service was also very attentive and friendly. I'd definitely go back.
author: Darrick J.

description:
Awesome place!  The food was great and so was the service too!
We had the lamb and paella valenciana and would definitely have it again!!
author: Dar F.

description:
OVERPRICED. Small selection. Small portions. Not very authentic at all. Try Mi Lindo Peru or Cholo Soy if you want more authenticity. If you want some good Pollo a la Brasa (rotisserie chicken), Limon is very good as well. The better Peruvian places are in the Mission. 

The service wasn't that great either. We came for lunch and the restaurant was empty. They took forever to bring our food out.
author: Nathan H.

description:
I love this place, it is my hidden gem in SF. I live extremely close to La Fina Estampa and this is one of my go-to dinner date spots for many reasons. You can typically get a table without a res, the food is amazing, sangria is awesome (and cheap), and the owner / waiter Luis is them man as well. The sangria is key for dates at it just keeps flowing and is delicious, so every one gets a little loose by the end of the meal. Perfect. The vibe inside is classy and romantic. It's decor has nice wooden paneling with candles on every table. I was shocked how nice it was inside when I first ate there as the outside of the restaurant is so unassuming. They should put some tables outside for lunch on the weekend!

My go-to items are as follows:

Ceviche Mixto - must have if you like sea food
Arroz Con Pollo - huge piece of chicken on a massive bed of cilantro rice. my fav!
Stuff crab - can't remember the exact name (congrello relleno or something) but crab filled with scallops, ridiculously good.
Sangria - cheap and delicious. 

Other notable items:
beef heart - good steak like meat and kind of crazy for adventurous eaters
Chicarones - good for sharing, fried chicken with lemon
sampler platter - good on your first time to taste a lot of dishes
free bread with dips - holy crap the green and red sauces are amazing. I wish they sold this stuff by the bottle.  
Pallella - I was expecting a Spanish style pallella with the soupy / saucy rice but this was a different style which was a little more dry. I think this is more Peruvian style. Was really good once I got over that fact.

It blows my mind this place isn't more popular. I have taken 20+ people here who had never even heard of it and every single one loved it without exception.
author: Andrew G.

description:
I came to this place because of the yelp reviews. Unfortunately, the service and the food were disappointing. We ordered the arroz con pollo and the tallarin saltado, we asked our waiter for recommendations and he said "if the food wasn't good it wouldn't be on the menu". They brought the food pretty fast but the arroz con pollo was very wet and the rice tasted like it was old. The tallarin saltado had this sour taste and it was over cooked.
I do not recommend this place to anybody. Especially for peruvian food, there are way better places in SF.
author: Kelly M.

description: Ate there with a few Peruvian and we all loved the food.  We had the lomo saltado and the ceviche de pescado. I would recommend this place very much.
author: Walter G.

description: This was my first and final trip to the Fina Estampa. While the food was okay, it was noting to rave about. More importantly, the service made the overall dining experience far less than enjoyable. The server's condescending attitude regarding our order was appalling and unwelcome. I am Peruvian, and well aware of how I would like to order my dinner. Additionally, as a Peruvian, I have never had orange ceviche lacking two important ingredients. I will not be returning to this establishment, and would not recommend it to anyone else.
author: Susana H.

description:
3.5 stars.
Good prices, food was good but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Came here on a Sunday evening around the time the Superbowl ended. The place was pretty empty except for 1 to 2 other couples there. 

Service was very good, our waiter was really nice, attentive and quick with the water refills. He also cautioned us when I was going to order the stuffed potatoes because most people aren't aware that it is mixed with mayonnaise.

THE FOOD:  

Chicarones (fried chicken)- 3 stars. Clear lemon-y sauce and fried chicken (not boneless, although most pieces were). It was alright, nothing special. 

Paella Valencia- 3.5 stars. The consistency of this dish was good- not dry and not soggy. The flavor however was weak. I was expecting more spices tossed in there. 

Fried Calamari- 4 stars. The portion was generous and the crispness on the outside was a good contrast to the chewiness of the squid & octopus. I also liked the lemon-y sauce.
author: Emily C.

description:
So happy this place is back!!! (I know it's been back for a while)

This new location is a lot smaller than the original location on Van Ness though the place is clean, cozy, and nice ambient. 

Our optimized favorite food here: 
- Lomo Saltado
- Anticuchos (Beef heart)
- Ceviche Mixto
- Arroz Con Pollo (Cilantro Rice with Chicken)

I love this place! Quiet, great service, clean and delicious food. I can't want more from little bistro-type restaurant :) 

We always leave here with smile :)
author: Mayumi Y.

description: I love this place, I went there for the first time and I got the sea food saltado and it was delicious.
author: Jasmine T.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up.  Loved the bread with the sauces and corn topping they brought to the table first.  I had a sangria and read the menu while I waited for my friend to arrive.  I made a reservation for us, and they gave us a lovely table right by the front window - nice!  

Had:
* Ceviche pescado (lots of fish, quite vingar-y but I could feel the love put into it)
* Lomo saltado (good flavoring, nicely balanced with the onions and fries, I got full off the bread so took this home, really good as leftovers, my bf was happy!)
* Flan (niiiice, creamy, bathed in a tasty caramel sauce...mmm!)

Service was really sweet, a little long on giving us our check, but I think there were only 2 servers on the floor so they were hopping taking orders and serving food and drinks.  

Cute neighborhood find - I'm glad Fina Estampa came back to the area!
author: Maile N.

description: My girlfriends and I are regulars - the service is always quick and friendly.  The food is delicious - we always get the Pescada Frito (fried fish with garlic sauce) and Paella Marinera (seafood and rice) and wash it all down with Sangria. Kitchen is literally run by mom and dad. Highly recommend!
author: Judy K.

description:
Randomly walked into this place for a late lunch.  We haven't eaten all day, so we asked if they would serve us from the dinner menu (to which they graciously accommodated) and then proceeded to order a ton of food!

The sauces that come with the bread are great

Chicharron de pollo - wow!  Perfectly fried!  So fluffy and the sauce that comes with it is perfect with it!

Calamari - really good!  Not too heavy on the breading

Lomo saltado - beef was so tasty and well marinated.  The juices from the beef seeped into the rice and was sooo good

Arroz com mariscos - also fantastic!  Lots of seafood, great balance of flavors

Only disappointing thing is that they were out of several dishes that we would have definitely ordered (ceviche, scallop appetizer, tamal).  Will definitely be back to try them!!
author: j k.

description: This place is awesome! Food is fresh and full of flavor , place is clean and well maintained!
author: Alena B.

description: Good family owned restaurant. The service is really great, and the ceviche is awesome.  Definitely a great place for authentic Peruvian, big dishes.  I live really close but I would drive pretty far to go get some Peruvian food here! Everyone should go!!
author: Mike B.

description: Fantastic authentic Peruvian food and great service. Highly recommend the Lomo Saltado and the Ceviche Mixto. Also, grab yourself a Cusqueña beer while you're there.
author: Pierre T.

description:
Great food! Location for parking isnt too bad.
Service is great!
author: Brittany C.

description: I can't  get enough  of this restaurant! I've  followed this restaurant for the last 25 years. Was on Mission  Street then on Van Ness now on Bush. Love Peruvian  food.
author: R P.

description:
I hate how this place moves constantly. Its my favorite Peruvian place ever. I've been going since I was a kid. I thought it's been lost FOREVER since it closed at Van Ness. That place was awesome! But to find out it just moved again, I WAS SO HAPPY! (Better to have moved than closed down for good.)

The best Lomo Saltado, Papa a la Huancaína, Anticuchos, and aji in San Francisco.  YUM!
author: Katelyn C.

description: This place was a hike to get to, but well worth the hike! Like people suggested I ordered the Lomo Saltado - the BEST lomo saltado. I also got the chicha morada and an order of ceviche. The food was really good, I was so happy I made it here all the way from Market street. It was a slow night, only one other table of four and only one waiter (who was very attentive) and one cook. Lucky for them there werent many tables, and at first I was hesitant to go inside since it was pretty empty. Glad I went in, this place is a def must go to when in SF.
author: Meli M.

description: I would love to go to this restaurant because the menu looks amazing and give a real review but after three attempts I give up. I tried coming during different times and always closed! Their answering machine no longer works so maybe they are out of business?
author: Serina J.

description: I like this small romantic restaurant. The waiter was really nice.  food came out super fast, despite them being pretty busy that night.  The cervice was pretty good.  everything was pretty good. I'm looking forward to going back
author: James T.

description: We always make it a point to come to this restaurant every time we come to San Francisco.  The food is wonderful.  But last Saturday was a disappointment with their customer service. And I was surprised to see the pictures that they had placed a fried egg on top.  The last time we came in and asked if they could do it for us, the guy said they couldn't.  Maybe again a pick and choose who they wanted.
author: TagaLoboc68 ..

description:
This was my first venture into Peruvian Cuisine - wonderful experience!!!

Before I had a chance to order, they started me off with these delightful sauces for my fresh bread.  They had the peppery brown one (which I gotta seek out the name for it) it was just outta sight!  In fact, if they had an item with just that sauce, I would order it.  There were two other dipping sauces one which was oil and parsely based and another with corn and hominy were terrific as well. 

So I had no idea on what to order.  I just told the waitress and she basically ordered for me! haha  My buddy got this peruvian fried rice dish and I got this perviuan chicken pasta dish.  How can I describe this?  The cuisine was like you had a hot latina girl and a handsome chinese guy (like myself) and had a kid! haha  The food was so good I had to get an extra order to go.  

They had warm and friendly staff, and a nice and clean atmosphere.  I also hear that this was a re-opening of sorts.  There was a former La Fina Estampa on Van Ness ... this is that restaurant's second coming.

Thank you La Fina Estampa for opening my eyes to Peruvian Food!
author: Andrew L.

description: We had their sangria, ceviche mixto for our appetizer. I had the lomo saltado de pollo and he had el plato pobre. There are no words on how to describe how good this meal was. You just have to go and enjoy. Go just go!.
author: Ana M.

description: I am Peruvian and this restaurant's food tastes homemade. The first night we went I had "Pancita"...  The best ever!!! It brought me back to all those times in Lima when on the way to my grandma's house my dad bought Pancita to eat at grandma's. That's how good this place is. The best thing other than the food was Luis, I don't know if he is the owner, the waiter or the guy in charge but he is so friendly and makes you feel at home in the restaurant. This is one of the best Peruvian restaurants I have ever eaten at. We didn't go anywhere else for dinner after eating there and if it wasn't because I live 400 miles away I would be there all the time. It is certainly the place to go every time you visit San Francisco and want some good Peruvian food. Los anticuchos? Para chuparse los dedos! Ceviche? Aya Yay! Delicioso!! La chicha morada sabrosísima. Todo muy, muy rico!!jj
author: Maritza V.

description: I really love coming to this restaurant. If you want to have authentic Peruvian food then this is the place to come to. A lot of restaurants say they are authentic and then you are left disappointed. I have always had great service and delicious food. From the anticuchos to the ceviche to the causa. Oh and the chicha morada that is always fresh. haven't ordered anything that I didn't enjoy. Every time I come to the city I must stop by.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Huge portions and delicious food, but sangria needs work (overpowered by wine with barely any traces of fruit). 

Bread with dipping sauces- the minced garlic and cilantro in oil oil dip was really good. There was also a spicy one and a dry topping with some kind of corn nuts.

Chorros A La Criolla- five large mussels marinated with onions, tomatoes and cilantro. There is a spicy kick to this and the mussels were fresh. 

Ceviche Mixto- white fish, prawns, squid with lots of sliced onions. Comes with a giant cube of potato and sweet potato and a half cob of corn, a nice touch to smooth out the taste buds when this dish is spicy and citrus-y. Also, this ceviche is ginormous, at least 3x bigger in portion size than other ceviches and it's only $13. 

Paella marinara- loved it. Wish it had more sour/tomato flavor (as this was heavy only on the saffron) and that it had more larger shrimps rather than the puny little frozen kinds you would see at Red Lobster. However, the rice was plump and moist and the overall taste was delicious.
author: K. N.

description: I have always liked (La) Fina Estampa back when they were just Fina Estampa on Van Ness.  I finally got a chance to stop by this new location.  I overheard that the wonderful Peruvian Japanese gentleman who used to make me sangria and pisco sours had passed away.  Tonight, the food was great, especially the pancita (grilled tripe).  It was so simple, yet so yummy.  My Camarones Al Ajo was just so delicious!   Of course, Lomo Saltado is always great.  Luis was enthusiastic and very friendly.  I will definitely return to try all the other dishes! - Adventures of Harry
author: Adventures Of Harry S.

description: How this place was able to get 4 stars baffles me. I came here for a friend of a friends bday dinner and was apprehensive prior. I should've stuck with my instincts. The food is shitty (no other word can really say it better than that) the taste was non existant, plain, and not made with love. There wasnt one dish that was good. There was only two other tables eating there as well. I also had to eat my dinner while having to inhale cleaning detergent that smelled like the floor had been just mopped. What a fricken waste of money and an appetite.
author: Diane L.

description:
The dips they served before the meal were sooooo good! I enjoyed all 3. They were served with bread. I can't remember what they were (I really should write reviews right after I go somewhere, but of course I never do), but the green one was my favorite. The red one with sausage in it I think was really good too, but a bit spicy to eat too much of it. 

I can't remember the name of the meal I got, but it was a pretty strange mix of food. There was a toasted bread on the bottom that was really good. It had a plantain on top of the bread, some type of meat (forgot which one specifically), an egg, and some type of sauce. Everything was delicious and the sauce leaked in to my rice and gave it such a nice flavor. I do have to say that I really didn't care for the plantain with it. The flavor just didn't seem to meld together well for me, but other people may enjoy it. Once I took out the plantain after taking a few bites with it, I enjoyed it much better.

And the 2 employees we dealt with there were really friendly. The restaurant was pretty empty so they had time to be really social with us and answer any questions we had and let us know their favorites there. They were very helpful.

I'd definitely go back if I was in the area, but not likely since I probably won't be in that area any time soon. But I definitely recommend trying them out!
author: Leslie F.

description:
Do you LOVE terrible service? If so, come here on Mother's day and you will be sure to have CRAPPY SERVICE that includes: appetizers being served after entrees, 3 out of 9 people waiting 20+ minutes for their food after everyone else has been served, and a lack of attentiveness to clearing items and empties off the table. 

I was seriously so upset that I was there with my whole family to celebrate Mother's day. 

Apparently the servers brought 3 of our dishes to other tables. How does this happen? Lack of communication. 

I could not even enjoy my lomo saltado (which was mostly french fries vs. steak) because I was so agitated. 

When the bill came they ended up only comping 5 of our beers, some coffees, and a dessert-AFTER they added in 18% gratuity. 

Seriously, skip this.
author: Misha F.

description:
La Fina Estampe was El Delicioso ! It was our first time here and wanted to try something different. I would call it somewhat upscale based on the costs of their dishes but it is worth every penny. I had the Beef Saltado and my wife had the Chicken Saltado...well I had that also as she got full...
Anyhow, it was bursting with flavors...it was so damn good. Even the bread with the 3 dips were just over the top yummy...
The server was really helpful and friendly. No complaints..If you have the urge to have a good $30.00+ meal and enjoy Spanish and Peruvian cuisine, I highly recommend this place. We will be back for sure.
author: David S.

description: 3.5-If you like rice or lamb this is the place.  We waited over 30 minutes for our food.  We were told it's a small kitchen.  If we were in line, we would have been #14 or so.  A big birthday party of six and two tables of four were ahead of us.  We ate alot of bread and the condiment sauce for the bread was really good to keep us from our hunger pains.  Water with lime was nicely refilled. Service was excellent, but it would be nice that they gave us a complimenatary flan for waiting so long.  My friend hinted, but the suggestion was not hypnotic enough.  The lamb had no lammy taste.  The paella marinara was tasty.  One absolutely thing I like is the nice dark atmosphere and quiet and calmness about the place.  Maybe because this place was not crowded.  Just to remind, this place is Spanish and Peruvian.
author: Helen L.

description:
This place we bumped into by accident. Was looking for parking to eat at a nearby sushi place and we parked right in front of this place. Saw it was peruvian and not busy and decided to try it out.

The arroz con pollo was amazing and the paella with sausage was delicious. They give you bread and 3 options to eat it with. I believe the red hot sauce looking one was my fav. 

Definitely try this out. I can't wait to go back and order the chicken and cilantro rice (arroz con pollo) again.

They weren't busy so the service was not bad.
author: Mellisa A.

description:
Absolutely fantastic - a prime example of San Francisco's fabled ethnic food.

It's a family restaurant .. you know the type: where your waiter alternates between a sweet 60 year old lady with a thick accent and her son. 

I've tried four different plates here and each has been fantastic - La Fina Estampa is a perfect mid-week stop.

Tips: they serve bread with some delicious toppings and a killer sangria
author: Nathan M.

description:
had lunch there and the BEST part was the bread basket with the 3 dips.  There is absolutely no need to use the butter.  Just go for the dip which includes Yellow and White corn, chopped up herbs, and some slightly spicy tomato paste... all very very good and totally worth going back for.
My lunch was ok because I ordered from the lunch menu.  I will definitely come back for dinner and try out the regular menu items.
oh yes, and the food is very homey style.
author: M S.

description: I agree that this place is a nice little hidden gem. The place is more spacious inside than it looks outside. I came here due to the good Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Tasty Peruvian food. They had the standard dishes such as Lomo Saltado. But I elected to try the Bistec a la Pobre which was steak with a cooked banana and egg. My friend had a buttery stuffed crab dish. Both were good. The dishes ranged from $15-20. They also had 3 tasty dipping sauces for the bread and food. I only wished that the bread was warmed. There was no difficulty in getting a seat on the weekend evening.
author: Ali F.

description:
Best Peruvian food I've encountered in San Francisco.
Very casual with great service.
Minus one star for boring, not-so-cute decor/ambiance.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Earned a five star review!

Truly incredible food (try the Pollo Al Oregano,) very friendly/prompt staff, good prices, and overall perfect experience. We'll come back next time we're in San Francisco!
author: Mark M.

description: I am a fan! Literally a hole in the wall in the heart of the Tenderloin. The restaurant itself carries a very pleasing intimate quiet atmosphere with dim lighting.  It's not as loud or busy as the popular Fresca, Mi Lindo Peru or Limon, so if you want to enjoy a quiet  peaceful dinner, then this place is for you. The food is delicious food and the service is fantastic. If you love seafood or Peruvian food in general, I would highly recommend this place. My favorite dish is the Cangrejo Relleno (stuffed crab shell with seafood and a buttery sauce) Its definitely underrated!
author: Clementine D.

description: I was a bit skeptical because of the outside decor but once we ordered food I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and prompt plus recommended dishes for us. The crispy chicken was not greasy but perfectly cooked. The scallops were yummy along with the sangria. The only dish I didn't like (but my friends did) was the feta cheese potatoes. Great little find that is perfect for small plates
author: Lisa B.
