description: Fabulous find off the beaten path. Ceviche is fresh and authentic. Excellent! Paella, arroz con pollo, and sangria are delicious. Prices average $15 per dish; portions are large and great for family style. Service can be slow, but staff is very friendly and accommodating. It's now on our family's regular restaurant rotation.
author: Jennifer P.

description: My favorite thing here is the salad that comes with your lunch is so good - simple and refreshing.  I've only been here for lunch and the price is right and the portions are generous.  I'm a fan of the Loma Saltado.  Service is attentive.  A neighborhood gem!
author: Amy P.

description:
Carlos treated us like family, he has been serving our Family for the better part of 20 years, and thru out those years, I took my family to celebrate my sons graduation, and we had a banquet of a meal, with 4 different entres, and 3 main course meals.
If you haven't eaten here you mus try the Saltado de mariscos, or the pariuela, Lomo Saltado de cualquier clase, and dont forget the flan, picarones, or the Lucuma ice cream, Thank you carlos for all the great years of service.

Percy G.
author: Percy G.

description: Looked for Peruvian restaurants in San Francisco and saw this place , tried to find parking, found one, put in $2.00 and walked inside and they said they are closed. They had people inside still but I guess not taking new customers, I checked opening hours before going and they we're suppose to be open until 11pm. They should fix their opening hours, so I don't waste my time looking for parking. If you check it right now, it says open :{, but luckily found another great place.
author: P V.

description:
A delicious surprise.  We had the huge ceviche mixto, a chicken tamal, and some type of crab stuffed with shrimp, crab, and scallops.  The crab at only $16 was incredible!  For two, it was definitely more than enough food.  

The also poured us very generous glasses of wine.  I found their house red wine at just $5 a  a really good compliment to the food.  

This was Friday night at 7, and we were the only ones in there.  Hopefully it gets busier as it was great food for a great price.
author: Plookie P.

description: By far would give it 10 stars if I could! Same owners from old locale on Van Ness. Food is just as delicious if not better. Best authentic Peruvian food in all of SF!!! Bistec a lo pobre, anticuchos, papa a la huancaina, I could go on. Yummy!!!
author: Mariana A.

description: Great service! Had the lemon chicken tapas and paella Valencia! Great neighborhood spot!
author: Joan C.

description:
Good food, reasonable prices, good service.

I don't really know enough about tapas to say much more.
author: xx x.

description:
I tried this place on a whim and absolutely loved it! We were seated right away and our waiter was very friendly and helpful. We shared everything family style and asked for some suggestions. We ended up eating the Ceviche, Lomo Saltado, Arroz con pollo, and a carafe of Sangria. The chicken was incredibly moist and flavorful and the rice it came with was equally delicious. The ceviche and lomo saltado were also amazing. I definitely plan on coming back and would recommend it to anyone.

Great neighborhood spot.
author: Megan K.

description: Awesome food and waiter is very nice.  It wasn't busy on a Saturday at 6:30 dinner.  I hope this place succeeds because they do have good food and service.
author: Tonee W.

description:
Good food, good service and good ambiance. What more do you need. I am vegetarian so there was practically nothing on the menu for me, but the chef was nice enough and came out to ask me if she could cook up a vegetarian dish for me. She made me some noodles with veggies and it was good. 
But the stuff I liked the best was their wine and sauces. If you like reds with soft tanins they have a wine called Casillero de Diablo, was super smooth. And if you like hot stuff, their sauces are pretty great.

We are definitely going back here for the experience!
author: Mandy K.

description: Excellent service.  The paella valenciana and sangria were awesome.  Definately worth coming back!!
author: Brian F.

description: There are few times when I am motivated to go on Yelp and do a review but this little restaurant is excellent. Really fabulous Peruvian food, fresh and balanced home made traditional dishes done the right way! I brought my family from the east coast here and they are not very adventurous with food but they gobbled everything up! We ordered lomo saltado, picante de mariscos, tallarin de mariscos and Tallarin de carne, washed it down with a couple of Cusqueñas Peruvian beer.
author: Sonia B.

description: I love this place. I have tried a couple of other Peruvian restaurants in SF and this one is my favourite. I usually order Lomo Saltado and Chicarron de Pollo and both are delicious. The bread and the 3 sauces which comes free are great appetizers by themselves. I have not tried other stuff but what I have is fantastic. Will go here weekly. And BTW, if you don't visit during rush time, your food is prepared very quickly. During rush times, you got to be a bit patient but the experience is worth it.
author: Milad A.

description: This restaurant never fails me. Their service is always excellent and food is so scrumptious everytime my family and I visit. I love their cangrejo relleno, arroz con pollo and chicharron de pollo. I am always satisfied and full when I leave this place! I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Kay D.

description: Comes here every week if we can. Everything on the menu is great.., always good to ask the waiter to recommend something if you're not familiar with Peruvian good. Opens till 10pm, no need for reservation, but can always expect to have seats last minutes.   Great for date if you are looking for something cozy, relaxing and low key. Love this place!
author: Taoran Z.

description: I had only 3 plates, and 2 of them were delicious: Ceviche and Mussles.  For me the scallops with cheese were not the best but only because the cheese was killing the taste.  For sure i'll be back for more.
author: Pau R.

description: I really like this place.  Ceviche Mixto is amazing.  And the sauces with bread are great too.  Actually, everything I have tried in my four visits has been great.  Salad. Steak. Purple corn drink thing...  all really good.
author: James L.

description: Great ceviche! Went here on date night and got ceviche and sangria. The family atmosphere and charming vibe was amazing!
author: Lexi B.

description:
I recently discovered this restaurant in my neighborhood and was pleasantly surprised. 

The place is clean, well maintained and the staff are very friendly. The food is delicious and I went back a couple of times. Definitely try their sauces and the waiter even explained to us how the sauces are made (except for one secret ingredient).

Definitely recommend this place.
author: Sandeep A.

description:
Ambiance is lovely and the service is great.  I had never tried Peruvian cuisine before, and I really enjoyed the variety of dishes we had.  The appetizers were unique, flavorful - I particularly liked the potato dishes and the calamari.

I had the herbed chicken for dinner.  The rice and chicken were both delicious. Flan for dessert was superb!  Perfect place for the family or a nice date.  Prices are right and the parking isn't bad at all!
author: Ashley S.

description: it was not for my dinner today. my dish tasted like burnt pan sauce. vegetables cut into neat little big size. I asked: lomo saltado. In place does not serve yuca  and Peruvian typical sauces
author: Salamone R.

description:
This was also my first foray into Peruvian although I had lunch. 

Easily the best $13 bucks I've ever invested in a lunch. I had the Paella which was really great.

I really liked the decor and it looks like it would be a great little spot for a cozy first date.

I highly recommend you yelpers give this place a try...
author: Kevin B.

description: Brought me back to Peru and my childhood memories, doesn't get more peruvian than that. Food, service, atmosphere  are awesome. Best peruvian place in SF.
author: Philippe R.

description: A gem without the fuss. No waiting in line, or snotty staff (like La Fusions) for getting a table. Traditional, authentic dishes.
author: Danielle L.

description: It's really pricey, and the food is "okay". There are better options in the city.
author: Danny K.

description: I went there with my mom a few weeks ago to try the lomo saltado. It was delicious! The restaurant was completely empty when we went on a Wednesday afternoon. Don't know if it gets more busy on other nights. You also get the standard sauces and bread at the beginning of your meal. Overall, it was a nice place with decent prices and good food.
author: Elio G.

description:
I came around 8pm on Friday night and the restaurant was empty except for one other table. I hope this changes, because La Fina Estampa is great! The service was very attentive and our dishes were very good.

- Pancita (grilled tripe)- delicious! The tripe was tender but slightly crispy, with a nice smokey flavor. Def recommend!  
- Ceviche Mixto- I've had my fair share of ceviche and this dish was a tad too limey for my taste. It was good that the dish also came with sweet potato, corn, and potato to give my tongue a break from all of the citrus.
- Paella Valenciana- amazing! Unlike another reviewer said, my paella was very flavorful and moist. The seafood and sausage were great and the portion was HUGE. 

Will definitely be back!
author: Stefi C.

description: Luis our waiter was wonderful! He recommended some dishes for us to try based on what our tastes are.  We really enjoyed the experience here.  We will be back.
author: Lynn L.

description: Mu husband and I were new to the area when we first tried La Fina Estampa.  We were looking for peruvian food and found this place on Yelp.  He orderes the lomo saltado and I had the paella valenciana - both were fantastic! We alsoo started with the causa rellena appetizer (potatato stuffed with chicken), which was different than what we had expected but SO good.  We just returned for our 3nd time on Friday.  We had the lomo saltado (again, can't go wrong) and arroz con pollo.  We got the causa again too. So delicious - definitely a keeper!
author: Meaghan P.

description: Came again with my sis and my dad and it was even better! I put the pictures up but we had ceviche, lomo saltado (perfection), pollo a la fina estampa (amazing I love the spices), and bistec a lo pobre (super juicy). Amazing food, super friendly people, and a great price.
author: Anna M.

description: I'm Peruvian and I have a chef for a mother. This place has the most authentic, classic Peruvian dishes in all SF. My favorites include their papa a la huancaina and their tallarin con pollo. These remind me of the home-cooked meals my mother used to make in Lima. The prices are reasonable and the service is excellent. Oh, don't forget to order the chicha morada for beverages; this is made fresh!! Beat that Limon!!! The only negative aspect is the location; very hidden from Polk street. Regardless, I recommend this to everyone that enjoys exotic dishes. I will be back.
author: Roberto G.

description: NOT vegetarian friendly at all. Very rude to not offer any vegetarian items on such a big menu, with the exception of a egg dish. Many vegetarians like myself don't eat eggs either.
author: Daniella C.

description: I am a Peruvian San Francisco native and grew up eating homemade Peruvian food that my father prepared with his recipes that have been passed down from my abuela. I know good authentic Peruvian food and fina estampa is it! I have been to limon, la mar, fresca, and another small Peruvian restaurant over by the ballpark and this is by far the BEST Peruvian restaurant in San Francisco. The chef and my father come from the same small town, Callao, Peru and share the same cooking styles. They actually know each other so My sister and I are always greeted warmly and treated like family. It feels just like home. They have excellent service and amazing food, a truly authentic and family owned&operated restaurant. If you are looking for the real deal this is it! I reccomend the papa a la huancaina, tallarin saltado, lomo saltado, ceviche, everything is good!
author: Julia ..

description: They have delicious and generous lunch portions at great prices. The service is superb and the waiter is always very well-mannered when bringing each dish to the table. There's hardly ever a wait during lunch time so that's a huge plus. I highly recommend this spot!
author: Abby R.

description: Wow this is a great Peruvian restaurant!!! Tammy and her Husband are super nice and the food is perfect.
author: Adam G.

description:
I was hoping to give this place a better review but it was simply a mediocre, so-so meal and I have had better.

We ordered a ceviche dish -- it was fine, big portion. Nothing to write home about.

We also had the paella valenciana -- it was very monotone, from the saffron color to the flavor. The shrimp, chicken, sausage, etc did nothing to the flavor and the rice didn't seem to be infused with the flavors of the ingredients...it was almost like a plain rice dish with those ingredients mixed in. 

Third dish we had was the beef with fries and rice. Asked for it to be cooked medium (vs well-done, the only two choices) and it arrived well-done. Nothing special about the dish. 

Service was okay, lighting was a little dark making it hard to read the menu.

Ate at the other location on Van Ness years ago and recall it was sort of mediocre back then too. Unfortunately I probably won't try this place again. It didn't have much business which I think is a reflection of its fare.
author: D L.

description:
Driving down Bush Street and saw the Grand Opening sign out in front of Fina Estampa. Peruvian/Spanish? Gotta love that. A parking space right out front meant this was my lunchtime destiny.
Lunch menu is short and everything is under $10. Meals come with soup or salad. I ordered Saltado de Pollo. Salad was fresh and nicely dressed with a simple vinaigrette. Saltado de Pollo came as a sort of stir-fry mixing chunks of Chicken breast, onions, peppers, tomatoes and french fries in a soy based sauce served with rice on the side. It was hot, fresh, tasty and filling. 
Took a peak at the dinner menu and saw many interesting options for future visits. I'll be back!
author: Kurma T.

description: Went there at 12 noon and they were not open with no sign explaining why. boo!
author: Alexis B.

description:
Excellent food. Super service. Great value.
Served family style.
The authentic Peruvian dishes we had were great.
The hors d ourves sauces were terrific.
author: Kim K.

description: Definitely a place to try. Big portions and really friendly wait staff. The prices seem to be rising but you could definitely split an entree and get an appetizer. Bread and sauces are delicious.
author: Gabriela A.

description: Friday early evening dinner.  Got a super unfriendly waiter who apparently could not give an opinion between 2 dishes.  Anything I asked for was  apparently asking for too much such as " would you pace the dishes so that they don't come out at the same time?"  He was not likeable AT ALL. The owner should do himself a favor and get someone else.  The bus boy saved the evening.  Food was good enough, but nothing exciting.  They were out of alfajores which was amazing the last time I had it at their Van Ness location.  :(  Even so my husband's tip was over 20% which I was not happy about.  How would he know he did not do his job right?  On the other hand I sure hope that he compensated the bus boy that saved him!!!
author: A D.

description: Wonderful, delicious food and friendly, inviting service.  Give it a try!  Glad we did!
author: Christopher C.

description: the place itself is OK, but nothing fancy, I wasn't impressed with food either. I was expecting something different, special, but service not the greatest, waiting time slightly to long. Not a lot of Peruvian food restaurants in San Fran. Not my favorite one.
author: Mathew S.

description:
Had dinner, or tried to, here. 

The place was not busy, but the service was very slow to come over and get our drink order (20+ min). They seemed very disorganized, and we were not attended well up until we got someone to take our order.

I have a Gluten allergy, I explained this to the waiter and he had no idea what that was. This probably should have been our first sign to up and leave, but being used to it, I explained what I couldn't eat (wheat/barley/rye things like soy sauce and bread). After a long exchange I was recommended  a steak and chicken dish as they contained no soy sauce. I opted for the Chicken, Arroz Con Pollo. 

When the food arrived some time later, the chicken was breaded, rendering it unsuitable for me to eat. Though they eventually did confirm that yes it was indeed breaded and took it off the bill, but I wasn't going to attempt to order anything else by this point.

The folks I ate with (who don't have food allergies) were unimpressed by the food, though it appeared to be well portioned. 

Bottom line, this is not a place to eat if you have a food allergy, the staff are untrained at handling it.
author: Erik H.

description: Best culinary experience available in the tenderloin besides ler ros I absolutely loved the Lomo Saltado! This is the only restaurant with Peruvian Malbec wine in the whole city!!!
author: Alicia P.

description: Been going to Fina Estampa since the days it was located on 20th / Mission and for good reason. Thus, it being alive and in business since the real early 90's with the owner also being the chef! It always tastes as authentic as my H.S. Girlfriend's fathers cooking from Peru! I've tried several other Peruvian restaurants and this comes closest to home cooking without all the "fusion" involvement! I recommend a visit and the prices / portions are equal and fair! Hope all enjoys this place as I have since childhood! Thx Fina Estampa for being there!
author: Edward B.

description: Delicious Peruvian food!!! GREAT bread and sauces...I had the Bistecca la pobre and was amazing!!! Great service, plenty of parking and fresh yummy food.. Im taking one star away just because ceviche was good but i had better, needed more lemon/citrusy flavor but everything else was delicious...
author: Gigi S.

description: I love peruvian food. This place is really good and the price is great. Not too expensive. I love the lomo saltado y la papa a la huancaina. The service is great too. Looking forward to go there again. Taste fresh.
author: Caro O.

description: Came here tonight with my husband. I ordered the arroz con pollo and it was delicious! The service was also great! Will definitely be back!!
author: Gaby G.

description: This place is amazing!If you love peruvian food and not breaking the bank then this is the spot. Small and cozy and the staff is helpful and friendly. Had everything i would expect from the menu. The ceviche is amazing and of course the Paella Valenciana. Ive eaten at every peruvian place in the city and this is now going to be a regular spot for me from now on.
author: Lilia D.

description: I never write reviews but this restaurant definitely warrants one.  I had the white fish ceviche and the limo saltado, both were amazing!  Very reasonably priced and great lunch deals.
author: Adam S.

description:
I used to be a regular customer when they were located on MIssion Street.  
The food is very good and my favorite is Pollo Al Oregano, moist and tasty chicken. The 2 sauces are very good that come with bread.  Also don't forget to try their chicha, purple corn drink. They do a great version.  I found the service to be fine, no issues whatsoever.
author: Eleanor L.

description: So happy they opened a new location. Lomo Saltado I missed you!
author: Craig I.

description: Fantastic food!  Nice service but slow. I was there for lunch and just noticed it for the first time. It was delicious and a really good value. I particularly liked the trio of condiments served with the bread. Whatever the red relish is, it is amazing. I will be back!
author: Jennifer R.

description: I've been going here since it was located on Geary and Van Ness.  I love their complimentary aji sauces.  I typcially get the Lomo Saltado with a Crystal (beer not the champagne!).  The ambience of the new location is great.
author: Godwin W.

description:
I visit this place probably twice a month as my wife is from Peru and she missis her moms cooking. We have tried pretty much everything on their menu by now and there is nothing we don't love. 

Their Causa and Picante de Mariscos are my absolute favorites. also try the anti cucho's as they are great. Just a great little restaurant with some tasty authentic cooking. 

i am waiting for the day they put Aji de Galina on their menu!
author: Bart V.

description: The food is good, not great. Don't know why some dishes come with rice under dinner menu. It is kind of pricy for the portion as more than half are rice. The dipping for bread was great!!
author: Shrabbit A.

description:
first time trying peruvian food...it was amazing!
what to get
-lomo saltado or the version with chicken in it
arroz con pollo = chicken and rice
for desert= aflajores omg! 

i wonder how other peruvian places will compare...
author: raji b.

description: Had the ceviche to start, which was really tasty. The paella marinera was a lot of food, but the seafood and rice was all one big chewy glop.  Bev's fish was fresh and well prepared. Felt sorry for them cause nobody was in there. I think they mean well and will probably improve. I'd give the place a second chance if I lived in S.F
author: Rob F.

description: I walked in and was seated right away (lucky me, I was the first customer for the evening and beat the rush).  My server recommended a seafood dish and it was divine! He provided excellent customer service and the manager even came by to check on me to see if everything was to my liking (of course, I said yes).
author: Gezelle G.

description: One of the best Peruvian locations I've been to in a long time! The food quality was excellent and the service was also very pleasant. I had the lomo saltado and the beef quality was very good. The meat was very tender and grade A steak quality. The majority of our party had the saltado de pollo and was also very satisfied with their meals. We had a party of 10 and the server was very attentive and welcoming. Very clean location in the downtown area. A bit pricey, but given the food quality, very well worth the cost. I will be making it a point to come back on my next visit to SF.
author: Aaron V.

description:
A friend of mine took me here on a Saturday night and I loved everything.  Of course, the bread and dipping sauces were a hit.  We ordered the beef heart which was unique and amazing.  Next, for our entrees, I got the popular & typical peruvian dish (but I forgot the name of it...) and she got one of her favorites, I think the Milanesa.
Service was great and friendly.  Would love to return again!
author: Debbie H.

description: I love coming to places like this...the food is naturally good and authentic. The places are family owned so service is courteous and friendly. Portions are large and delicious for the price and you get to travel (via dining) to a location you never thought you'd visit. My first time having Peruvian food...and it does not disappoint!
author: Morin O.

description: I came here on Mother's Day with my husband and in-laws. I should have known when they told us it would be at least an hour and a half wait (and we were the only ones waiting) that it was a bad sign. When we finally were seated, I looked around and noticed that most of the tables that were there when we got there were still waiting for their food..another bad sign. When the waiter finally came to take our order, he handed us a notebook and told us to write down our order...WTH?! There were only 5 of us...not like we had a huge party or anything. After ordering, two of us got our dishes within 15 minutes. After that, another 30 minutes passed before they brought out two more dishes! By then, the first two had already finished eating. Then the worst part: my mother-in-law was the only one left without her food. This, being on Mother's Day, and her being the only mother at the table. We inquired about her food multiple times, and were told the same thing repeatedly: "it's coming, it's coming". After about 45 minutes, she was hungry and cranky and asked the waiter once more where her food was. His response: The kitchen was small and the cook could only make one dish at a time. When she finally got her meal, over an hour had passed since they had brought us the last dishes. There is seriously no excuse for that kind of bad service. Another thing I noticed: in between serving our table, I saw them bring out dishes for two other tables (each with 2 people) that arrived way after us, and those people were able to eat and leave before we even got our last dish! WTF?! If the cook can only make one dish at a time, wouldn't it make sense to serve one entire table first? We spent a total of 4 hours at that restaurant, which was WAY too long. We went for lunch and by the time we got out, it was dinnertime. I don't know if it was just the holiday or what, but you'd think they'd step up their game for an occasion like Mother's Day (and make sure mom doesn't get served last!). This restaurant seems to have terrible (or non-existent) management. I saw the waiters arguing in the kitchen with the owner over our table, but no one took responsibility or even made an attempt to apologize to us for the wait. And unlike the previous reviewer who also went on Mother's Day, they didn't offer to comp any part of our meal-not even drinks :(  They also added in 18% tip, and there were only 5 of us. I guess they knew how crappy their service would be in advance. I'm so so sad to see the name Fina Estampa dragged through the mud, especially when the original restaurant had much better food AND much more competent management.
author: Michelle M.

description: Worst service ever! We had someone with a gluten allergy and the waitstaff was not knowledgeable about the food at all. Recommended 2 dishes, when we ordered one it arrived with a breaded piece of chicken. We explained allergic to wheat. Perhaps he doesn't understand flour is made of wheat?! Or perhaps he likes pain like you've been kicked in the stomach repeatedly?! Beyond horrible service and food that was mediocre at best.
author: D H.

description: I love this place!! Yummy/amazing food, awesome atmosphere, beautiful decor, and the owners are AMAZING! They are very welcoming and kind! The waiter is great/professional!           My husband and I are regulars here, we bring our baby, and do not get the cold stares like at some other restaurants.
author: Inna R.

description: Happened to come here before a show and was surprised by how good the food was.  It's a modest establishment, seemingly family-owned.  I ordered the arroz con pollo (chicken and cilantro rice).  Would have liked some more veggies to balance it all out, but it was absolutely delicious.  The chicken was incredibly moist, and the rice had so much flavor.  I'd say the atmosphere was mediocre, but the service and food were superb.  Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but if I'm in the neighborhood, I will definitely consider!
author: Alice Y.

description: I havent had GOOD food like this in probably over a year... My bf and i stumbled across this place looking for somewhere new to eat and DAMN am i glad we did! first things first, they sit you down in this great ambiance, small but not too small, Peruvian music playing not too loud, and the staff super friendly. We sit down and they bring out this trio of salsas with some bread. I go for the green stuff first and take a bite. I totally SWOOONED! it was so good i couldnt believe it. We then stuffed ourselves with the salsas so we didnt order an appetizer this time. As an entree I got the stuffed crab with scallops prawn and crab in a white wine Parmesan butter sauce. I never wanted it to end it was just so good. It came with white rice that tasted like heaven i dont know WHAT they did to it, accompanied by a deep fried chunk of potato. MY bf got the broiled steak topped with fried banana and egg and grilled onions. It came with this piece of french bread under it to absorb all the flavor and juices. UGHH SOOO YUMMY. We still cant get over it so im pretty sure well be back before the end of the week! They also have a great wine selection with wines from Peru, Argentina, and Spain. IM IN LOVE!!! VIVA LA VIDA!
author: Caitlin G.

description: Great food awesome service.  Had the sautéed beef with french fries.  Loved the chimichurri sauce.
author: Juan L.

description: I'm so happy they reopened Fina Estampa.  My husband and I been customers since they were on Van Ness and when they closed we were always looking for a great Peruvian spot and did not find one to our liking.  They can count on us to keep coming to this spot because there food is magnificent try the Lomo Saltado.
author: Ines M.

description: My family and I were THRILLED to find out this wonderful restaurant re-opened for business! We first went to Fina Estampa when it had the small whole in the wall on Mission Street. Then, we went to the location on Geary and S. Van Ness. We were heartbroken when its doors closed a couple of years ago. We've tried several Peruvian restaurants since and none has the family atmosphere or the flavorful food like Fina Estampa. Today, we went to the new Bush location. The food was GREAT as we remembered it. It will be a MUST stop when we are in the city. No doubt about it! Our menu today: Paella Valenciana, Papa a la Huancaina, Anticuchos, Conchitas a la Parmesana, and Ceviche Mixto. Try it out! You can't go wrong!
author: Raul R.

description: Fortunely for my Family, Gustavo and Tammy decided to Re-open La Fina Estampa. For years has been our Family Restaurant. We're Nicaraguans but in deep love with Peruvian Cuisine. Services, quality of food,decor, everything is Outstanding. For lunch, I bring my Coworker and they keep coming with their families. Thanks Gustavo and Tammy for given us the honor of enjoy your Cuisine.
author: Renato P.

description: This place is just next door to my gym, so it is very convenient for me.  We finally tried it for dinner twice, and loved it twice.  The wine was great.  The service was prompt, helpful, and friendly.  The menu offers a broad selection.  The serving size for all dishes we tried (8-10 different ones) was between average to large.  And the food was TASTY!  All in all, this place is great, I totally recommend it.  You should definitely check it out.
author: Ken B.

description: Super good food, very authentic. Very yummy anticuchos (skewered beef hearts for those that don't know) and the little sauces that they serve with everything are delish -- the chimichurri is awesome!! Definitely going back one day.
author: Suzie P.

description: I will keep this short and sweet.  It was delicious, the staff was very attentive without being overbearing, the setting intimate and small, and day-um that was some good sangria!  Plus the price could not be beat for all of the food that we were provided.
author: Amy F.

description: Fantastic! Best Peruvian in The City! Beef heart was incredible and ceviche to die for.
author: Dan T.
